channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Anxious Chinese students are scrambling after Marco Rubio says the State Department will ‘aggressively’ revoke visas: ‘The U.S. was known for its diversity… it is a pity to see such change’
item.description: China’s Foreign Ministry said “such a politicized and discriminatory action lays bare the U.S. lie that it upholds so-called freedom and openness."

item.title: JetBlue and United are forming an alliance to sell each other’s seats. Here’s what that means for flyers
item.description: United will return to JFK airport after leaving 10 years ago.

item.title: McKinsey’s headcount is down more than 10% in the past 18 months. That’s the biggest loss in the consulting firm’s history
item.description: The company says the decrease is due to normal attrition and performance review firings.

item.title: Kohl’s shocks investors reporting a not-too-bad quarter even after it fired its CEO just 100 days into the job
item.description: The retailer still reported a 4.1% year-over-year net sales drop, but that was better than what analysts expected.

item.title: Meet Dr. Annie Andrews, a pediatrician who plans to give Lindsey Graham a run for his money in South Carolina
item.description: In her launch video, Andrews takes aim at Graham's capitulation to Trump, as well as Elon Musk and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.

item.title: CEO confidence hasn’t plummeted like this since at least the 1970s
Nvidia will do what it takes to recapture China opportunity: analyst
‘Magnificent Seven’–tracking ETF in rally mode after Nvidia’s earnings
Why Apple investors should be bracing for a wave of downgrades
Wall Street enthusiasm over tariff ruling tempered by what’s-next uncertainty
